repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
The dataclass module specifically guards repr from being invoked recursively. I use a slightly different method here to do the same thing.

Part of https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4956

comment_data.body:
Shouldn't the name of the type be the name of the test class? Otherwise, there's no recursion, right? Or am I missing something?
```suggestion
class C_TestReplace_test_recursive_repr:
    f: 'C_TestReplace_test_recursive_repr'
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -548,6 +548,48 @@ class C_TestReplace_test_initvar_is_specified:
     def __post_init__(self, y):
         self.x *= y
 
+@dataclass
+@cclass
+class C_TestReplace_test_recursive_repr:
+    f: 'C'

comment_data.body: You're right, but the file is auto-generated (by reprocessing the CPython tests) so it'll need fixing in the script that generates the file rather than here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -548,6 +548,48 @@ class C_TestReplace_test_initvar_is_specified:
     def __post_init__(self, y):
         self.x *= y
 
+@dataclass
+@cclass
+class C_TestReplace_test_recursive_repr:
+    f: 'C'

comment_data.body: I'm made all of these typed as `object` (which is enough for the tests to work... I think practically this was how Cython was typing them with the wrong name). Obviously accurate typing would be nicer, but since they're being produced from a fairly dumb conversion script `object` seems universal and good enough
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -548,6 +548,48 @@ class C_TestReplace_test_initvar_is_specified:
     def __post_init__(self, y):
         self.x *= y
 
+@dataclass
+@cclass
+class C_TestReplace_test_recursive_repr:
+    f: 'C'

commit.message:
Fix recursive repr on cdef dataclasses

The dataclass module specifically guards repr from being
invoked recursively. I use a slightly different method here
to do the same thing.

Part of https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4956

commit.message: Simply repr for cases that can't recurse
Handle string annotions in test converter

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix recursive repr on cdef dataclasses
